action.action-desc: Mr. LaHood introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to allow producers to file a one-time program contract for certain programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lessening Regulatory Burdens on our Farmers Act of 2018.

section.header: One-time filing for ARC and PLC

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), the Secretary of Agriculture shall allow producers that enroll in the agricultural risk coverage or price loss coverage during the first enrollment period announced by the Farm Service Agency after the next Act authorizing agricultural programs for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2018 to file a one-time program contract for enrollment in such programs for the duration of such authorizing Act.

In the case of a change in a farming operation for which a producer on a farm has filed a program contract described in subsection (a), the producer shall file an updated program contract with the Secretary of Agriculture not later than one year after such change occurs.

The Secretary of Agriculture shall provide to each producer that enrolls pursuant to subsection (a), a notice that includes the annual and other periodic reporting requirements applicable to such producer, as determined by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: issue such regulations as are necessary to carry out this section; and
revise section 1412.41 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, in accordance with this section.
